org.gicentre.geomap
Class GeoMap

java.lang.Object
  org.gicentre.geomap.GeoMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
Geographic
public class GeoMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements Geographic

Class for drawing geographic maps in Processing

Version:
1.0, 11th January, 2012
Author:
Iain Dillingham and Jo Wood, giCentre, City University London.

Constructor Detail

GeoMap

public GeoMap(processing.core.PApplet parent)
Creates a map with the default bounds.

Parameters:
parent - The parent sketch.

GeoMap

public GeoMap(float xOrigin,
              float yOrigin,
              float mapWidth,
              float mapHeight,
              processing.core.PApplet parent)
Creates a map with the given bounds.

Parameters:
xOrigin - The position of the map from the left of the sketch.
yOrigin - The position of the map from the top of the sketch.
mapWidth - The width of the map.
mapHeight - The height of the map.
parent - The parent sketch.
Method Detail

draw

public void draw()
Draws the map in the parent sketch.

draw

public void draw(int id)
Draws the feature that matches the given id.

Parameters:
id - ID of feature to draw.

draw

public void draw(java.lang.String attribute,
                 int col)
Draws all features that match the given attribute stored in the given column of the attribute table. If not features are found or the given column is out of bounds, nothing is drawn

Parameters:
attribute - Attribute identifying features to draw.
col - Column in the attribute table (where ID is column 0) to search.

getID

public int getID(float screenX,
                 float screenY)
Reports the ID of the feature at the given location in screen coordinates or -1 if no feature found.

Parameters:
screenX - x-coordinate of screen location to query.
screenY - y-coordinate of screen location to query.
Returns:
ID of feature at given coordinates or -1 if no feature found.

geoToScreen

public processing.core.PVector geoToScreen(float geoX,
                                           float geoY)
Should provide the screen coordinates corresponding to the given geographic coordinates.

Specified by:
geoToScreen in interface Geographic
Parameters:
geoX - Geographic x coordinate.
geoY - Geographic y coordinate.
Returns:
Screen coordinate representation of the given geographic location.

screenToGeo

public processing.core.PVector screenToGeo(float screenX,
                                           float screenY)
Should provide the geographic coordinates corresponding to the given screen coordinates.

Specified by:
screenToGeo in interface Geographic
Parameters:
screenX - Screen x coordinate.
screenY - Screen y coordinate.
Returns:
Geographic coordinate representation of the given screen location.

readFile

public void readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Reads geometry and attributes from a shapefile.

Parameters:
fileName - The name of the file without extension. A shapefile consists of three separate files called fileName.shp (the geometry), fileName.dbf (the attributes) and fileName.dbx (an index file).

writeFile

public void writeFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Writes geometry and attributes of this geoMap object as a shapefile.

Parameters:
fileName - The name of the file without extension. A shapefile consists of three separate files called fileName.shp (the geometry), fileName.dbf (the attributes) and fileName.dbx (an index file).

getNumPoints

public int getNumPoints()
Reports the number of point objects that are stored in this geoMap object.

Returns:
Number of point objects stored.

getNumLines

public int getNumLines()
Reports the number of line objects that are stored in this geoMap object.

Returns:
Number of line objects stored.

getNumPolys

public int getNumPolys()
Reports the number of polygon objects that are stored in this geoMap object. Note that a complex polygon with several parts will be considered a single object.

Returns:
Number of polygon objects stored.

getNumLineVertices

public int getNumLineVertices()
Reports the total number of vertices in all line features stored in this geoMap object.

Returns:
Number of line vertices stored.

getNumPolygonVertices

public int getNumPolygonVertices()
Reports the total number of vertices in all polygon features stored in this geoMap object.

Returns:
Number of polygon vertices stored.

getNumPolygonParts

public int getNumPolygonParts()
Reports the total number of polygon parts in all polygon features stored in this geoMap object. Simple polygons have one part each. More complex polygons can consist of several parts such as islands, holes etc.

Returns:
Number of polygon parts stored.

getFeatures

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Feature> getFeatures()
Reports the collection of features that make up this geoMap object.

Returns:
Collection of features each addressable by some unique ID.

getAttributes

public Table getAttributes()
Reports the attribute table associated with this geoMap object.

Returns:
Attribute table associated with this geoMap.

setAttributes

public void setAttributes(Table attributes)
Sets the attribute table to be associated with this geoMap object.

Parameters:
attributes - New attribute table to be associated with this geoMap.

getMinGeoX

public float getMinGeoX()
Reports the minimum geographic coordinate in the x-direction.

Returns:
Minimum geographic coordinate in the x-direction.

Reports the minimum geographic coordinate in the y-direction.
